    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(java.lang.String customer,
                              java.lang.String apikey,
                              android.content.Context context,
                              MovinSDKCallback callback)
        Initializes the MovinSDK. This is the starting point for all SDK related features. The device will be checked for compatibility with Bluetooth Low Energy and some primary components are initialized.
        Parameters:
        customer - The customer name, provided by Movin
        apikey - The apikey associated with this customer, either provided by Movin or generated in the Movin Portal
        context - The context required to access device specific properties.
        callback - The callback will be called once the initialization is finished. Provides a boolean whether it has succeeded and if not an Exception containing the error.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Un-initializes the MovinSDK

      • getBeaconScanner

        public static MovinBeaconScanner getBeaconScanner()
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the singleton instance of MovinBeaconScanner, which should be used to scan for beacons in an infrastructure
        Returns:
        The singleton instance of MovinBeaconScanner
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an error if the MovinBeaconScanner cannot be retrieved, for example when the SDK has not yet been initialized or when Bluetooth is not available on the device

      • getProximityEngine

        public static MovinProximityEngine getProximityEngine()
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the singleton instance of MovinProximityEngine, which should be used to scan for all iBeacons around
        Returns:
        The singleton instance of MovinProximityEngine
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an error if the MovinProximityEngine cannot be retrieved, for example when the SDK has not yet been initialized or when Bluetooth is not available on the device

      • getMaps

        public static java.util.List<MovinMap> getMaps()
                                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Returns a collection of available maps
        Returns:
        A collection of available maps
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If an error had occurred, for example when the SDK has not yet been initialized

      • getMap

        public static MovinMap getMap(java.lang.String id)
                       throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Returns a MovinMap object with the specified id. If the specified id is not available it will return null
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier of the map (_id)
        Returns:
        A MovinMap object with the specified id. If the specified id is not available it will return null
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error had occurred, for example when the SDK has not yet been initialized
        java.lang.RuntimeException

        public static boolean getServiceSupported(int service)
        Checks if the given service is supported both by the device and apikey rights.
        Parameters:
        service - The service to check for
        Returns:
        Whether or not the service is supported.

        Parameters:

      • clearCache

        public static void clearCache()
        Clears the cached files stored by the MovinSDK.

      • setCacheProtocol

        public static void setCacheProtocol(int types,
                                    MovinCacheProtocol cacheProtocol)
        Sets the cache protocol for the specified data types. Note that this can only be used before the MovinSDK is initialized. 
         

// You can use the MovinCacheableData int constants as flags, i.e.:
MovinSDK setCacheProtocol(MovinCacheableDataPositioning|MovinCacheableDataMapData, MovinCacheProtocol.default());
        Parameters:
        types - The types for which to set the cache protocol, should be one or more of the MovinCacheableData int constants
        cacheProtocol - The cache protocol to set

      • getCacheProtocol

        public static MovinCacheProtocol getCacheProtocol(int type)
        Gets the cache protocol for the specified MovinCacheableData type
        Parameters:
        type - The MovinCacheableData type for which the cache protocol is needed
        Returns:
        The MovinCacheProtocol for the given MovinCacheableData type

      • getStyles

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,MovinTileStyle> getStyles()
                                                                    throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Returns a collection of available styles.
        Returns:
        A collection of available styles.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the styles could not be found an exception will be thrown.
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • getStyle

        public static MovinTileStyle getStyle(java.lang.String name)
                               throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Returns a MovinTileStyle object with the specified name. If the specified name is not available an error is set.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the style.
        Returns:
        A MovinTileStyle object with the specified name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the style is not available an exception will be thrown.
        java.lang.RuntimeException

        Returns:
        A shared MovinI18N object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If an error had occurred this will be thrown

      • performChecks

        public static java.lang.RuntimeException performChecks(int service)
        Performs the validity checks for the given service, to see if the apikey has rights to it. Also performs more general checks
        Parameters:
        service -
        Returns:
        An exception if one of the checks failed
